intro: Peucedanum turgeniifolium, commonly known as the Turkestan cowparsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbrella-shaped clusters. Native to Central Asia, this plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its roots and seeds have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. However, it is important to note that some species in this genus can be toxic, and caution is advised when handling or consuming it.
